attributes.action: stop the age discrimination against men inherent in the State Retirement Pension.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Currently the qualifying age for a state pension is 65 for men born on or before 5 April 1959 and 60 for women born on or before 5 April 1950. In addition, men who work after the age of 60 have to pay National insurance Contributions of about 11% of their earnings, and women do not. This is blatent discrimination, and cannot be justified.The Government are very keen to outlaw many types of discrimination, but, strangely, are quite content to allow this one to continue.
